00048 fsal_status_t FSAL_truncate(
00049     fsal_handle_t         * p_filehandle,         /* IN */
00050     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,              /* IN */
00051     fsal_size_t           length,               /* IN */
00052     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_object_attributes   /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00053 ){
00054   
00055   int rc, errsv;
00056   struct stat buffstat;
00057   fsal_path_t fsalpath;
00058   fsal_status_t st;
00059       
00060   /* sanity checks.
00061    * note : object_attributes is optional.
00062    */
00063   if ( !p_filehandle || !p_context )
00064     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00065     
00066   /* get the path of the file and its POSIX information */
00067   st = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_filehandle, 0, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00068   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(st)) Return(st.major, st.minor, INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00069   
00070   /* check if it is a file */
00071   if ( !S_ISREG(buffstat.st_mode) )
00072   {
00073     Return(ERR_FSAL_INVAL ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00074   }
00075 
00076   /* Executes the POSIX truncate operation */
00077   
00078   TakeTokenFSCall();
00079   rc = truncate(fsalpath.path, length); 
00080   errsv = errno;
00081   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00082   
00083   /* convert return code */  
00084   if (rc)
00085     Return( posix2fsal_error(errsv), -errsv, INDEX_FSAL_truncate );
00086   
00087   /* Optionally retrieve attributes */
00088   if( p_object_attributes ){
00089     
00090     fsal_status_t st;
00091         
00092     st = FSAL_getattrs( p_filehandle, p_context, p_object_attributes );
00093     
00094     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( st ) )
00095     {
00096       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00097       FSAL_SET_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00098           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00099     }
00100 
00101   }
00102   
00103   
00104   /* No error occurred */
00105   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_truncate);
00106   
00107 }
